title: Frictionless Standards
text: fr provides fr_tdr, fr_schema, fr_field objects implementing frictionless tabular-data-resource standards R.

title: Frictionless Standards
text: Install {fr} CRAN: can install development version {fr} GitHub :

title: Frictionless Standards
text: See vignette("read_fr_tdr") read Frictionless Tabular Data Resource disk web, access metadata, manipulate data.frame See vignette("creating_a_tabular-data-resource") create Frictionless Tabular Data Resource converting data.frame tibble, adding metadata, writing disk

title: Frictionless Standards
text: Developed Open Knowledge Foundation, frictionless standards set patterns describing data, including datasets (Data Package), files (Data Resource), tables (Table Schema). Data Package simple container format used describe package collection data metadata, including schemas. metadata contained specific file (separate data file), usually written JSON YAML, describes something specific Frictionless Standard: Table Schema: describes tabular file providing dimension, field data types, relations, constraints Data Resource: describes exact tabular file providing path file details like title, description, others Tabular Data Resource = Data Resource + Table Schema CSV dialect: describes formatting specific various dialects CSV files Data Package & Tabular Data Package: describes collection tabular files providing data resource information along general information package , license, authors, metadata

title:
Coerce character, factor, numeric, logical, and Date
vectors into fr_field objects — as_fr_field
code: as_fr_field(1:10, "example_integer") # -> frictionless number #> example_integer #> - type: number as_fr_field((1:10) * 0.1, "example_double") # -> frictionless number #> example_double #> - type: number as_fr_field(letters, "example_character") # -> frictionless string #> example_character #> - type: string as_fr_field(factor(letters), "example_factor") # -> frictionless string with enum constraints #> example_factor #> - type: string #> - constraints: enum = a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i, j, k, l, m, n, o, p, q, r, …, #> y, and z as_fr_field(c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE), "example_logical") # -> frictionless boolean #> example_logical #> - type: boolean as_fr_field(as.Date(c("2023-04-23", "2004-12-31")), "example_date") # -> frictionless date #> example_date #> - type: date

title: Coerce a data frame into a fr_tdr object — as_fr_tdr

title: Coerce a data frame into a fr_tdr object — as_fr_tdr
code: as_fr_tdr(mtcars, name = "mtcars") #> mtcars #> # A tibble: 32 × 11 #>      mpg   cyl  disp    hp  drat    wt  qsec    vs    am  gear  carb #>    <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1  21       6  160    110  3.9   2.62  16.5     0     1     4     4 #>  2  21       6  160    110  3.9   2.88  17.0     0     1     4     4 #>  3  22.8     4  108     93  3.85  2.32  18.6     1     1     4     1 #>  4  21.4     6  258    110  3.08  3.22  19.4     1     0     3     1 #>  5  18.7     8  360    175  3.15  3.44  17.0     0     0     3     2 #>  6  18.1     6  225    105  2.76  3.46  20.2     1     0     3     1 #>  7  14.3     8  360    245  3.21  3.57  15.8     0     0     3     4 #>  8  24.4     4  147.    62  3.69  3.19  20       1     0     4     2 #>  9  22.8     4  141.    95  3.92  3.15  22.9     1     0     4     2 #> 10  19.2     6  168.   123  3.92  3.44  18.3     1     0     4     4 #> # ℹ 22 more rows as_fr_tdr(mtcars, name = "mtcars")@schema #> mpg #> - type: number #> cyl #> - type: number #> disp #> - type: number #> hp #> - type: number #> drat #> - type: number #> wt #> - type: number #> qsec #> - type: number #> vs #> - type: number #> am #> - type: number #> gear #> - type: number #> carb #> - type: number

what: dplyr methods for fr_tdr objects — dplyr_methods
title: dplyr methods for fr_tdr objects — dplyr_methods
text: basic dplyr functions re-implemented fr_tdr objects. input converted .data.frame() passed dplyr function. resulting tibble object converted back fr_tdr object, matching table- field-specific metadata possible using as_fr_tdr() specifying .template argument.

title: dplyr methods for fr_tdr objects — dplyr_methods
code: fr_mutate(x, ...)  fr_rename(x, ...)  fr_select(x, ...)  fr_filter(x, ...)  fr_summarize(x, ...)  fr_arrange(x, ...)

title: dplyr methods for fr_tdr objects — dplyr_methods
code: read_fr_tdr(fs::path_package("fr", "hamilton_poverty_2020")) |>   fr_mutate(next_year = year + 1) |>   fr_rename(new_year = next_year) |>   fr_select(-new_year) |>   fr_filter(fraction_poverty > 0.1) |>   fr_summarize(median_poverty_fraction = median(fraction_poverty)) |>   fr_arrange(median_poverty_fraction) #> hamilton_poverty_2020 #> - version: 0.0.1 #> - title: Hamilton County Poverty Rates in 2020 #> # A tibble: 1 × 1 #>   median_poverty_fraction #>                     <dbl> #> 1                   0.216

title: About the fr package — fr-package
text: fr provides functions objects reproducibly create track changes metadata alongside code creates data. prevents disconnect data metadata, also allows computing metadata create richer documentation. fr package provides fr_tdr, fr_schema, fr_field objects provide representation Frictionless Tabular Data Resource standards R. fr_tdr, frictionless tabular data resource, object encapsulates data metadata building top data.frame list data resource-specific metadata properties (e.g., name, description). one fr_schema (Frictionless Schema) object. One fr_schema object, list table-specific metadata properties. One list fr_field objects, list #' field- (column-) specific metadata properties (e.g., name, type, constraints) Normal usage require using as_fr_tdr() create fr_tdr object based data.frame tibble.

title: About the fr package — fr-package

title: read a tabular-data-resource into R — read_fr_tdr
read a tabular-data-resource into R — read_fr_tdr
text: file Either path file, connection, literal data (either single string raw vector). file can also character vector containing multiple filepaths list containing multiple connections. Files ending .gz, .bz2, .xz, .zip automatically uncompressed. Files starting http://, https://, ftp://, ftps:// automatically downloaded. Remote gz files can also automatically downloaded decompressed. Literal data useful examples tests. recognised literal data, wrap input ().

title: add or update field-specific metadata in a fr_tdr object — update_field
code: my_mtcars <-   mtcars |>   as_fr_tdr(name = "mtcars") |>   update_field("mpg", title = "Miles Per Gallon")  str(my_mtcars@schema@fields$mpg) #> <fr_field> #>  @ name       : chr "mpg" #>  @ type       : chr "number" #>  @ title      : chr "Miles Per Gallon" #>  @ description: chr(0)  #>  @ constraints: list()
